attractions.name: Old San Juan
attractions.description: The heart of Puerto Rico’s history and culture, featuring colonial architecture, cobblestone streets, and historic forts.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Take PR-26 from Luis Muñoz Marín Airport, then PR-1 into Old San Juan. Paid parking available.
how_to_get_there.by_bus: AMA Bus Route T5 or M3 from Condado or Santurce.
how_to_get_there.by_trolley: Free trolley service within Old San Juan.
how_to_get_there.by_ferry: Take the Cataño Ferry from Cataño to Old San Juan.

attractions.name: Castillo San Felipe del Morro
attractions.description: A 16th-century fortress that guarded San Juan Bay, featuring breathtaking ocean views and historic military structures.
attractions.entrance_fee: $10 per person (includes access to Castillo San Cristóbal)

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive into Old San Juan and park at a nearby garage, then walk to the fort.
how_to_get_there.by_trolley: Take the free Old San Juan trolley to the entrance.

attractions.name: Castillo San Cristóbal
attractions.description: The largest Spanish fort in the Americas, built to protect San Juan from land attacks.
attractions.entrance_fee: $10 per person (includes access to El Morro)

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive into Old San Juan and park nearby.
how_to_get_there.by_trolley: Free trolley service stops at the fort.

attractions.name: La Fortaleza
attractions.description: The Governor’s mansion and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, originally built as a fortress.
attractions.opening_hours: Guided tours available during government hours

how_to_get_there.by_car: Limited parking, best accessed by walking or trolley within Old San Juan.

attractions.name: Museo de Arte de Ponce
attractions.description: Puerto Rico’s most famous art museum, featuring European and Puerto Rican masterpieces.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Easily accessible from PR-52 with parking on-site.
how_to_get_there.by_bus: Local bus service available from downtown Ponce.

attractions.name: Ponce Historic Zone
attractions.description: A district rich in neoclassical architecture and cultural heritage.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive via PR-52, parking available in various locations.
how_to_get_there.by_bus: Public transportation options available in Ponce.

attractions.name: San Germán Historic District
attractions.description: A colonial town with well-preserved Spanish architecture and historical landmarks.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Accessible via PR-2, with parking available in the town center.
how_to_get_there.by_bus: Limited public transportation options from larger cities.

attractions.name: Flamenco Beach
attractions.description: One of the most beautiful beaches in the world, featuring white sand and crystal-clear waters.

how_to_get_there.by_ferry: Take the ferry from Ceiba to Culebra.
how_to_get_there.by_plane: Fly from San Juan or Ceiba to Culebra Airport.
how_to_get_there.by_car: Golf cart or taxi rental available on the island.

attractions.name: Playa Buyé
attractions.description: A tranquil, scenic beach with clear waters and soft sand, perfect for relaxation.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive to Cabo Rojo and follow signs to Playa Buyé. Parking is available.

attractions.name: Crash Boat Beach
attractions.description: Known for vibrant blue waters, diving spots, and a lively atmosphere.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Take PR-2 to Aguadilla and follow signs to Crash Boat Beach.

attractions.name: Luquillo Beach
attractions.description: A family-friendly beach with calm waters and famous food kiosks.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive east on PR-3 from San Juan to Luquillo Beach.

attractions.name: Playa Jobos
attractions.description: A surfer’s paradise with strong waves and a laid-back vibe.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Take PR-2 to Isabela and follow signs to Playa Jobos.

attractions.name: Tortuga Beach
attractions.description: A hidden, untouched gem known for its crystal-clear waters and peaceful atmosphere.

how_to_get_there.by_boat: Take a private boat or water taxi from Culebra to Culebrita.

attractions.name: Playa Escondida
attractions.description: A secluded, stunning beach accessible by a scenic hike.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive to Seven Seas Beach in Fajardo and hike to Playa Escondida.

attractions.name: Domes Beach
attractions.description: One of the best surfing beaches in the Caribbean, located near a decommissioned nuclear power plant.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive to Rincón via PR-115 and follow signs to Domes Beach.

attractions.name: El Yunque National Forest
attractions.description: The only tropical rainforest in the U.S. National Forest System, featuring waterfalls, hiking trails, and diverse wildlife.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Take PR-191 from Río Grande into the forest entrance.

attractions.name: Mosquito Bay
attractions.description: The brightest bioluminescent bay in the world, glowing due to microorganisms that light up when disturbed.

how_to_get_there.by_ferry: Take the ferry from Ceiba to Vieques, then drive to Mosquito Bay.
how_to_get_there.by_plane: Fly to Vieques from San Juan or Ceiba.

attractions.name: Cueva Ventana
attractions.description: A breathtaking cave with a large window opening overlooking the valley below.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Take PR-10 to Arecibo and follow signs to Cueva Ventana.

attractions.name: Camuy River Cave Park
attractions.description: One of the largest cave systems in the Western Hemisphere, featuring underground rivers and limestone formations.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive via PR-129 to Camuy River Cave Park.

attractions.name: Guánica Dry Forest
attractions.description: A unique ecosystem and hiking destination known for its dry climate and biodiversity.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive via PR-333 to Guánica Dry Forest Reserve.

attractions.name: Gilligan’s Island
attractions.description: A small, beautiful island great for kayaking and shallow-water swimming.

how_to_get_there.by_boat: Take a water taxi from Guánica to the island.

attractions.name: Toro Negro State Forest
attractions.description: Features waterfalls, hiking trails, and Cerro Punta, Puerto Rico’s highest peak.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive via PR-143 to Toro Negro State Forest.

attractions.name: Isla de Mona
attractions.description: The 'Galápagos of the Caribbean,' featuring unique wildlife and rugged terrain.

how_to_get_there.by_boat: Accessible by chartered boat from Mayagüez.

attractions.name: Charco Azul
attractions.description: A picturesque natural pool in the mountains, ideal for swimming and relaxation.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive to Charco Azul via PR-184 in Patillas.

attractions.name: Las Paylas
attractions.description: A natural waterslide and swimming area in the rainforest, carved by the river.

how_to_get_there.by_car: Drive via PR-983 in Luquillo to the entrance.
